title: Blackbeard's True Target is Ace, Not Luffy
theoryText: When Blackbeard states he's hunting 'one man worth 100 million' in Episode 151, many fans theorized he was actually targeting Portgas D. Ace, not Luffy. While both had bounties around 100 million at this time, Blackbeard's strategic goal of becoming a Warlord required capturing someone significant - and Ace, as Whitebeard's 2nd Division Commander, would be a much more valuable prize to the World Government than the relatively unknown Luffy.
author: One Piece Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: This theory is validated when Blackbeard captures Ace and trades him to become a Warlord, leading to the Marineford War.

popularity.supportingEvidence: Blackbeard's later actions of capturing Ace and trading him to the World Government confirm this was his plan all along.

title: Laffitte Has a Siren Mythical Zoan Devil Fruit
theoryText: Based on Laffitte's ability to sprout wings and his later demonstrated hypnosis powers, fans theorize he possesses a Mythical Zoan fruit based on the Siren from Greek mythology. Sirens in Greek mythology were bird-women hybrids known for their hypnotic voices that could control people - perfectly matching Laffitte's demonstrated abilities of flight and hypnosis. His wings appearing white and angelic supports the bird-woman connection, and his ability to infiltrate Mary Geoise undetected suggests supernatural stealth abilities.
author: 50cherrypies (Tumblr)

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory based only on Episode 151 appearance

popularity.supportingEvidence: Laffitte has wings and uses hypnosis, both associated with Sirens. His character design and abilities align with Greek siren mythology.

title: The Five Elders Are Immortal Through the Ope Ope no Mi
theoryText: When the Five Elders debut in Episode 151, they appear as elderly men who already seem ancient and knowledgeable about world history. Fans theorized early on that they might be immortal, possibly through the Ope Ope no Mi's immortality surgery. Their extensive knowledge of world events spanning centuries and their apparent unchanging appearance in flashbacks suggested they had lived far longer than normal humans. This theory gained traction as more was revealed about the Ope Ope no Mi's ultimate ability.
author: One Piece Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory involves later revelations about the Five Elders' true nature and the Ope Ope no Mi's immortality surgery.

popularity.supportingEvidence: The Five Elders' apparent immortality and vast historical knowledge suggests they've lived for centuries. Later chapters reveal their true nature and connection to ancient powers.

title: Doflamingo Controls Marines With String Powers
theoryText: In his first appearance in Episode 151, Doflamingo forces two Marines to fight each other. At the time, the exact mechanism wasn't clear, but fans immediately theorized he had some kind of puppet-control ability. Many speculated he could create invisible strings to control people's movements like marionettes. This theory was developed based solely on his first demonstration of making Marines attack each other against their will.
author: One Piece Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory confirmed when Doflamingo's Ito Ito no Mi abilities are fully revealed during the Dressrosa arc.

popularity.supportingEvidence: Doflamingo is later confirmed to possess the Ito Ito no Mi (String-String Fruit) which allows him to create and control strings, including using them as puppet strings.

title: Luffy and Blackbeard Are Dark Parallels
theoryText: From their first appearance together in Episode 151, fans noticed striking parallels between Luffy and Blackbeard. Both are D. clan members, both have grand ambitions (Pirate King), both value dreams highly, and both are gathering crews. However, their philosophies diverge - where Luffy values friendship and freedom, Blackbeard seems willing to betray and manipulate to achieve his goals. Fans theorized that Blackbeard represents what Luffy could become if he abandoned his morals, making them narrative foils destined for a final confrontation.
author: swans-anime-ramblings (Tumblr)

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory discusses Luffy and Blackbeard's eventual final confrontation as the series' climax.

popularity.supportingEvidence: Both characters share many superficial similarities but opposing moral philosophies. The narrative has consistently positioned them as rivals destined to clash.
